hadith: Actions are judged by intentions.
The best among you are those who have the best manners.
Allah does not look at your appearance or wealth, but at your hearts and actions.
None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.
Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day should speak good or remain silent.
A good word is charity.
The strong man is not the one who overcomes others by strength, but the one who controls himself when angry.
The one who guides to something good is like the one who does it.
Do not waste water, even if you perform ablution on the banks of a flowing river.
The one who is not grateful to people is not grateful to Allah.
Modesty is part of faith.
The best charity is that given when one is in need and struggling.
Smiling at your brother is an act of charity.
A true Muslim is the one from whose tongue and hands others are safe.
The believer is not one who eats while his neighbor is hungry.
The most beloved of deeds to Allah are those done consistently, even if they are small.
Paradise lies under the feet of mothers.
Do not be angry, and you will enter Paradise.
Whoever removes a hardship for a believer in this world, Allah will remove a hardship from him in the Hereafter.
Whoever builds a mosque for Allah, Allah will build for him a house in Paradise.
He who does not show mercy to others will not receive mercy.
The best of you are those who learn the Quran and teach it.
Whoever follows a path seeking knowledge, Allah will make his path to Paradise easy.
A kind word and forgiving faults are better than charity followed by hurtful words.
Every act of kindness is charity.
The Prophet (ﷺ) was more shy than a young girl in her private room.
He who does not thank people has not thanked Allah.
Whoever fasts Ramadan with faith and seeking reward, his past sins will be forgiven.
The one who maintains ties of kinship will have their sustenance and lifespan increased.
Do not envy one another; do not inflate prices; do not hate one another; and do not turn away from one another.
The most beloved deeds to Allah are offering prayers on time.
Your smile for your brother is charity.
A believer is like a date palm tree, whatever it takes from it is beneficial.
Do not curse time, for Allah is time.
When one of you makes dua, let him not say, ‘O Allah, forgive me if You will.’ Rather, let him be firm in asking.
The best of companions in the sight of Allah is the one who is best to his companion.
Allah helps His servant as long as the servant is helping his brother.
A person will be with those whom he loves.
The most beloved people to Allah are those who are most beneficial to people.
The best of people are those who bring the most benefit to others.
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The strong believer is better and more beloved to Allah than the weak believer, but there is goodness in both.'
When a person dies, his deeds end except for three: ongoing charity, beneficial knowledge, or a righteous child who prays for him.
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'A Muslim is the brother of a Muslim. He does not oppress him, nor does he abandon him.'
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'A good dream is from Allah, and a bad dream is from Shaytan.'
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Whoever prays Fajr is under the protection of Allah.'
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The best supplication is Alhamdulillah.'
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The best of you are those who feed others and return the greeting of Salam.'
The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Fear Allah wherever you are, follow up a bad deed with a good one, and behave well towards people.'
